node.title: On the upside the drought map is finally clear. On the downside more flooding is expected this week
node.description: More rain and renewed flooding are expected for the east this week as many catchments are already at capacity.
node.content:
["Here we go again, as\u00a0another day of widespread storm activity is expected across eastern Australia.\u00a0", "Forecasters have tipped today will be the biggest storm day of this cycle,\u00a0with the focus\u00a0on northern New South Wales and South-East Queensland.\u00a0", "So be prepared for delays if you are trying to watch the cricket.", "\"It really is another week and another potentially heavy rainfall event for eastern Australia, which is very much in line with the current La Ni\u00f1a pattern at the moment,\" the Bureau of Meteorology's Jonathan How said.", "\"For Brisbane, there is the risk of potentially severe thunderstorms.\"\u00a0", "Large hail, damaging wind gusts and heavy bouts of heavy rainfall are all on the cards but are not expected to be quite as extreme as recent ones.", "Adding depth to this order, an\u00a0upper-level trough is expected to\u00a0help push a low\u00a0over NSW late today.", "\"So apart from general showers and thunderstorms across the eastern seaboard, we are likely to see some areas of heavy rain develop,\" Mr How said.\u00a0", "As the low moves off into the Tasman Sea on Thursday, it is expected to direct\u00a0a moist, easterly flow across\u00a0southern NSW and eastern Victoria.", "But the location of the heaviest falls will depend on where the low moves.", "\"The computer model guidance is still a little bit divergent at\u00a0this stage, but suggesting that the area of focus will be south of Sydney, around the South Coast and down towards Victoria,\" Mr How said.", "", "
Hit-and-miss thunderstorms coupled with\u00a0divergent models mean it is difficult to know where\u00a0the heaviest rain will fall, but the east coast is generally looking at a soggy end to the week.(Supplied: Bureau of Meteorology)
", "According to the forecast, Gippsland could be in the firing line and\u00a0heavy rain could push as far inland as\u00a0Canberra.\u00a0", "
With the rain come the floods
", "Mr How said with the forecast rainfall,\u00a0some renewed rises and potentially some flash flooding would occur along the coast.", "Systems that have already seen major flooding, such as\u00a0the\u00a0Lachlan, are expecting more rain this week.\u00a0", "", "
An upper level trough is expected to encourage a\u00a0low pressure system to form over NSW today and into tomorrow, directing heavy rain to southern NSW\u00a0and eastern Vic.(Supplied: Bureau of Meteorology)
", "\"We've got plenty of moderate-to-major flood warnings across multiple catchments and it's going to pretty much remain that way for the next couple of days, if not weeks, even probably months as well,\" Mr How said.", "Hazardous conditions are also expected to develop along the coast, pushing\u00a0up to\u00a0Sydney on Thursday and into Friday.", "
Rainfall deficiencies over\u00a0
", "Finally, after years of red, the drought map is a sight for sore eyes with only a tiny section of the country still in rainfall deficit over a 20-month period.", "", "
After years of seas of red, the drought maps that mark rainfall deficiencies are now largely clear up to a two-year period.(Supplied: Bureau of Meteorology)
", "Even the parts of Queensland that stubbornly avoided the rain last year have caught up during what has been the country's wettest November on record.\u00a0", "\"Even though we were in La Ni\u00f1a last summer, the Wide Bay and Capricornia really missed out on the rain. But this year they've really been hit quite hard,\" Mr How said.", "\"That's actually been enough to reverse some of these rainfall deficiencies across southern, south-eastern parts of Queensland.\"\u00a0", "Boondooma Dam inland of the Sunshine Coast is\u00a0overflowing for the first time in eight years.\u00a0", "", "
Despite rain causing\u00a0havoc for some\u00a0in the east, good prices could make for a bumper year for the nation as a whole.(Supplied: Damien Blazer, Quambatook, Vic)
", "The rain has been devastating for some but Australia as a whole is currently on track for a record crop\u00a0this\u00a0season.", "
Hot in the West and North\u00a0\u00a0
", "While the east has been soggy, the west has been baking.\u00a0", "\"Severe to extreme heat conditions have been pretty much just gripping northern Australia\u00a0with consecutive days in the high 30 (degrees Celsius)\u00a0to low 40s,\" Mr How said.", "Port Hedland has recorded six days in a row over 43 degrees Celsius\u00a0for the first time; impressive given readings there date\u00a0back to 1942.\u00a0", "The heat is being attributed to an unusual lack of sea breeze.", "Nearby, Marble Bar has already cracked 46C.\u00a0", "", "
The monsoon hasn't moved down just yet but it shouldn't be far away.(Supplied: Wendy Hume, Townsville, Qld)
", "Thankfully, showers and storms are expected to increase over the next few days, bringing a bit of relief.", "While it is not quite officially the monsoon yet, monsoon-like conditions are expected to kick in later this week and into next.", "The monsoon trough\u00a0is currently lurking up over Indonesia and is expected to move down earlier than usual ensuring\u00a0a steamy La Ni\u00f1a summer.\u00a0"]
